Reviews.Content: Absolute Disgrace Im 22 and am just back from Barcelona where i was on holiday with my Boyfriend (27). We stayed in Barelona for ten days in total, the first six where spent in the city and we decided to break up the holiday with a stay at the beach so we booked the Apsis BCN Events in Casadellfelds.Firstly what is not mentioned on their website is that the hotel is actually located right in the middle of an Industrial Estate and quite literally on the motorway!!!All bar one member of staff were incredibly rude and should not be working in the hospitality industry and no one seemed in a rush to do anything (including check you in).When we got to our room eventually, we found the following problems* Mini bar unstocked and filthy dirty, (this was not cleaned for the duration of our stay even though we had advised reseption of this)* Lining behind curtains ripped* Carpets all along our floor (2nd Floor) filthy dirty* In room safe would not work for the duration of our stay* On wall card taker for electricity kept falling off!!* TV remote brokenAnd just to put the icing on the cake when we woke every morning at around 10am we found the delightful smell of sewage coming up from the drain pipes in the bathroom!!But it was the end of our holiday so we decided to make the most of the situation. so we decided to head for the beach, when we asked at the reception how to get there we where told we could either get a taxi or walk and that the walk would take us only about 20 minutes, so we decided to go for the walk. 40 minutes later we arrived at the Beach!!!! But we persisted and continued on with our day, with the dread of the trek home, only to find that we would get a bus which stopped just across the road from the hotel for just 鈧?.30!!!Not only this but there is also a railway which goes just behind the hotel!!We went for a meal on one of the nights in the hotels restaurant which was very over priced and average.On the following night we decided we would just have some drinks and bar food, only to be told that they had no Vodka and couldnt make Mojitos and the only bar food they had consisted of chips or croquettes, they ran out of Pizzas!!!???!!!Needless to say our last meal was spent elsewhere.The only saving grace of the hotel was the pool, which although clean on the inside was a disgrace around the area surrounding the pool. The bins where constantly over flowing and never changed and the whole area needed a good clean and sweep down. All of issues where brought to the attention of the hotel reception and the majority of them where left unacted upon.The whole stay was very disappointing and it is beyond me how this hotel can call itself a four star accomodation. Its a disgrace.I would never recommend this hotel to any of my family or friends and would strongly advise anyone who is considering going there to reconsider.
Reviews.Author: bobby1986

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel We go to Barcelona every year for a week or so. We love the place! We have tried hotels in and around Barcelona. We always have a car and without doubt you really do need to have a car if you want to stay at this hotel. It is a 20minute drive into Barcelona. We got this hotel for just under 鈧?0 per night BB. It was excellent value. The breakfast was self-service buffet (scrambled egg, bacon, fruit, cheeses, breads, cereals, coffee, toast, etc.). We thought the choice  quality of the food was excellent. After breakfast we used to take our coffees out onto the first floor veranda overlooking the pools. It was shaded and full of good quality wicker type furniture.......an extremely good start to any day.There are 2 outdoor pools, both are a good size. One is suitable for children (50cm deep). Our 2 year old wanted to spend all day, every day in it. The pools were never crowded and the hotel provided an endless supply of fresh towels at the poolside. They had a small wooden garden type shed that sold drinks and snacks during the day. The pool is next to the busy C32 motorway but the hedging all around the pool blocks this from sight. We never found the noise of the traffic to be off putting.The rooms are large. We noticed that the rooms on the pool side of the hotel appear to be larger than those on the front of the hotel. We were on the pool side and the room had an extremely large bed. There was a long 3 seater black leather sofa in the room. The tv was LCD (flat screen). The aircon worked perfectly. The bathroom was spacious with a shower in the bath. There was a fridge and safe. The floor covering was lamenated wood. Behind the hotel there was a very large new looking shopping centre full of cheap and reasonably ok restaurants. Across the motorway from the hotel was the olympic canal, where I assume sailing, rowing, etc. took place during the olympics in 1992.If you want a hotel on the beach, this is not your hotel; if you want one in the centre of Barcelona, this is not your hotel. However if you have transport and want an excellent hotel to stay at in the Barcelona area, then this is the place for you. I would go as far as to say that it was the best value in hotels that we have come across in Barcelona. It was spotlessly clean and we found the staff to be most helpful although they wanted 鈧?40 to do one load of laundry for us; instead we took it to a laundrette in that shopping centre behind the hotel and paid 鈧?5 instead.No place is perfect but next year I will stay here again.......provided we get a good deal.
Reviews.Author: YoungIrishman

Reviews.Content: return visit return visit after 12 months and found the hotel very satisfactory. The room was very clean and maid service every morning with fresh towels etc. The only negative thing about it is the breakfast tables were not clear and had to end up doing that our selves unless we went early. Plenty of selection and good value for money. The reception staff were very friendly and nothing was too much bother for them. We used the shuttle bus there and back from the airport and it was also very satisfactory. No hesitation in recommending this hotel .
Reviews.Author: KarenR007

Reviews.Content: 24 hour food in rest room vending machines NEVER stay here. Desk staff that lies to guests, extremely limited access to food and beverages, NO complimentary shuttle to airport unless it suits the front desk personnel. NO SERVICE. Pay whatever you need to pay to steer clear of this nightmare hotel. The housekeeping staff ignored the Do Not Disturb sign on the door and walked in on my husband and I, if you know what I mean!Nasty, nasty, nasty....rude, rude, rude
Reviews.Author: KCITravel

Reviews.Content: Terrible location, no great amenities, very loud because of events If you are wanting to visit Barcelona, this is not the right hotel to book. It's a 20+ Euro cab ride to the airport and to get into Barcelona, you have to walk about 15 minutes to the train station and then take a 40-45 minute train ride into the city to get downtown (to Passeig de Gracia). There is no free internet, the hotel restaurant is overpriced and because they host so many events, there was noise all night. When we stayed at this hotel, there were 2 weddings going on that lasted through the night and we could hear every song that was played. On a good note, they will arrange a taxi to the airport for you and the beds were pretty comfortable.
Reviews.Author: islachica13

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, bad location We arrived in Barcelona from Madrid via the AVE train. We stayed at Apsis BCN Events from April 24-27. Check in was easy and quick. It took us Less than 10 minutes to get our room. The rooms were spacious and extremely clean. The hotel is ideal for business conference meetings. The bathroom on the lobby floor is gorgeous. the staff members at the front desk were extremely helpful in helping us get around via train system because the hotel is at least a 1/2 your from the city center. But it is easy to learn. However, the trains shut down at 12:00am so that means if you party in the city center, then you would have to take a cab back to the hotel which can cost 30 euros or the bus which we never took because it would take over a hr. Right across from the hotel is Canal de Catuylna where you can go rollerskating, canoeing and other cool stuff. Great areas to visit in Barcelona is Ciudad Olympica and Port Vell. In Port Vell area you would find La Champanaria. Were you order a sandwich and then you get a bottle of Champaine. Just be ready for the crowd. You have to push your way in.I encountered one negative thing during check out. Make sure you look at your bill carefully because they charged me for the bar in which I never used. It was only a 1.50 euro but stil it should not have been on my bill.Overall, I would not stay here again only because it is too far away from everything. But I am very happy that I got the best of both worlds.
Reviews.Author: mellemel

Reviews.Content: Adequate We booked this hotel and stayed for 7 nights. The reception is very modern with funky light fixtures and the room that we stayed in was also very spacious and modern. The rooms were cleaned everyday and to a good standard. Nothing appeared to be too much of a problem with the reception staff, they also booked a transfer to to the airport free of charge. I would say it would be helpful to book your transfers (if you haven't already) with the hotel rather than paying over 拢20.00 for it. The two drawbacks were the actual location of the hotel as it took us about 40 minutes or so to get to Barcelona via the train. The train station is about 15 minutes walk from the hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you have very small children due to the location of the hotel. It appeared to me that they mainly accommodated for the business clients rather than tourist as such. At the time I was pregnant and didn't find the walking too much, as the weather was nice. The other drawback was the the pool. As the hotel is located near a main moterway you found that you could hear the noise at the pool. However, having said that me and my husband found that we were the only ones using the pool throughout the satisfy which was quite nice. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are looking fir a relaxing beach type holiday but rather if you want something comfortable and nice to go and sightseeing!Also a word of warning me and my husband got stopped by men (who weren't wearing uniforms) pretending to be policeman. They stopped us just a few minutes from the hotel. They asked us rudely that they wanted too see our passports and contents of my bag. When refused and questioned after a few minutes of asking they fled away in their car. After talking to a real policeman in Barcelona later that day we found out that this happens a lot in Barcelona so just be careful. Lucky we didn't hand anything over! Apart from that the hotel was wonderful x
Reviews.Author: tik1000

Reviews.Content: Never again Stayed here for a week and was really disappointed with it...if i had been more organsied I would have moved after a day. Various fixtures in the room were broken and never fixed despite being told they would be. The lights wouldnt work on numerous occasions and we were left sitting in the dark waiting for reception (who hung up on us twice when we rang to get it fixed) to come and look at it which they never did. The only room we were offered as a replacement was not normally let out as it had a broken window. Overall found the staff rude and unaccommodating. The location wasnt great either...especially as there was only a six-foot fence seperating the pool area from the motorway. Overall staying in this hotel is not worth the bother in my opinion and certainly more hassle than it is worth for a so-called modern hotel.
Reviews.Author: Scotland24

Reviews.Content: Good, in spite of location Stayed three for three nights in September 2007 and perfectly satisfied with the hotel. Plus points: rooms above average, food good (reasonable 12 Euro spread for breakfast and good value 20 Euro buffet including drinks in evening), very clean, extra-fast repair service when I arrived and found the bath and safe not working, free shuttle bus to and from airport - and the cost at 拢50 a night. Minus points: the location, right by a motorway (so using the pool and loungers right next to it and was less than appealing) and one mile from the beach, only one English language TV channel - and that was CNN, so less than great for the fair number of British visitors there when I was. But overall would certainly recommend and Castelldefels a nicer place than some tourist books I have read would suggest.
Reviews.Author: Cardicam

Reviews.Content: this place is chic my girlfriend found this hotel on hotels.com and we had to book it. the hotel was practically brand new, 4 stars, and the rate was phenomenal. we paid only $70 a night for this place. the inside of the hotel is incredible: marble, light woods, scandanavian furniture, funky light fixtures...very very expensive looking. they use this cool smart-chip key and after you unlock the door you put it into this slot just inside the entryway and it turns the a/c back up, the lights come on, and the room comes alive. anyway, the bathroom was cool too, marble, glass enclosed shower, bidet, and some top-shelf toiletries to go along with it. the bed was super-comfortable and there was also a 24-in lcd tv in the room as well. the furnishings were all beautiful and we felt like we were staying in a $700 hotel, not a $70 hotel. the pool was great. and at times were the only people in it, since the hotel was not that busy. the only thing i would say is a drawback would be the location. since it's not really by any tourist stuff, just the beach and the town of castelldefels. also, the local language is catalan, which means even if you do speak a little spanish you may have a problem communicating with the locals.
Reviews.Author: patrickhw

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel (for car users) I stayed here with my daughter (12 years) and her friend and had a twin room with extra bed. The size of the room was very adequate and was comfortable. We were on a room only basis so didn't try any meals although the breakfast spread did look good. We had a car for the duration of our stay of 5 nights. This made the location very good for visiting Barcelona, about 20 mins by car. We found parking easy and used the underground car park at the Colombus Monument. This was good for the Barcelona Touristic Bus. (We used the 50% off parking voucher you get with the bus tickets and paid about 鈧?.00 for the day).In the afternoon the kids used the spotlessly clean pool. In the evening we drove 5 minutes to the beach. There are 2 or 3 beachside restaurants serving the usual fare. We also visited Port Aventura which was just under an hour away. Fantastic day for all.For those without a car, there is a big mall across the road with the usual collection of international chain stores together with a good supermarket and plenty of eateries. If your Spanish isn't up to much beware...not much in english on the menu front but some pictures to help you point at what you may like to try.There is a frequent train service to Barcelona and the station is about a 5 min taxi ride or 20 min walk from the hotel.All in all a very good choice of hotel if you want to be away from the constant hustle and bustle of Barcelona but close enough to make it easy enough to get there and with the pool that has to be a bonus!
Reviews.Author: GlaswegianTraveller

Reviews.Content: very clean just returned from one weeks holiday at this hotel, my family and myself found it very clean and tidy, the beds really comfortable. we new it was a small drive from airport and barcelona so we hired a car for the whole duration, it took about 15 mins from airport and just a bit longer to barca. it pays you to do the tour buses in barca as you can jump on and off as you like for the sight seeing. you have to go to see the fountains at night they are totally fantastic and free. no trouble parking car at hotel which is free. breakfast o.k. but not fantastic.staff quite pleasant although did not speak much english. we found the best place to eat out was port olympic in barcalone, car park next to it and very cheap, there are lots of small eaterys around here and it looks so pretty at night as it is on a harbour. (THE PIZZA HUT HERE WAS GOOD AND STAFF VERY FRINDLY). the best beach which we found was actually at casteldelfels itself just about 3miles away, really lovely sand and fairly shallow, all the other beaches were small stones and very deep water near the edge. would go to hotel again they come and change your beds every single day and tidy room, it was the cleanest hotel i have ever stayed in although our room was right over the bar of the hotel the music stopped at around 12.30 each night, which is o.k. for older childre like mine as we were out till then but for younger ones may be to late.
Reviews.Author: fartins

Reviews.Content: Poor Service The location is far from the city, it's hard to walk from the bus station. We chose to stay one night because it's near the airport, and they provide shuttle bus service to the airport which showed in their website. Unfortunately, the reception told us that there is no service at weekend (we need to go to airport on Saturday 9 June 2007), so we took the train to airport. And, I asked why they didn't correct the information on the website, the lady answered that we could complain to the manager.Secondly, the staff gave us the room key which was already occupied, and made the same mistake twice. We had to take our luggage up and down to the reception 3 times. And, the most terrible thing is when we asked to talk to the Manager and complained to some staff, a staff called Renato who came up and said Please don't shut and said I don't like the way you are talking, I don't have to take it..., I'm here to help you (without showing any apology). But, he was not helping us, just corrected the mistakes which were the same.
Reviews.Author: TSL7805

Reviews.Content: Would Not Recommend For Short Break To Barcelona THIS HOTEL IS ON THE EDGE OF AN INDUSTRIAL ESTATE: We booked this hotel on-line for a city break to Barcelona, which we have spent mostfor our time on a bus. The nearest bus stop I would not advise you use as part of the way there is no foot path: back tracking to the other bus stop takes approx. 20 minutes on foot (I didn't feel very safe walking back at about midnight). Then your journey takes over anhour to get to the city. I will say that the bus service is good (timetable running every 20 minutes and into the night): but by the time we got to Barcelona we were so tried that walking around the city was not enjoyable. The hotel is right beside a motorway so thereis noise of the traffic all the time. In my opinion this hotel is suitable for business travellers but NOT holiday travellers like myself.
Reviews.Author: FLINTni

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel I stayed in this hotel in January 2007 and was very impressed with the hotel. The rooms are spacious and the price very reasonable. The bathroom are nice and the staff are very helpful. I asked for an iron and it was provided for me, eventhough they didn't provide me with ironing board. On the downside, the bed is a bit hard and the location is not ideal if you want to stay in central Barcelona. However, since I was here for business, this is not a problem. Breakfast was also very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: nooritsu

Reviews.Content: Not impressed... Positives:* Abundant free parking.* Attractive, modern rooms and hotel interior.* Located right off C31 for easy access from El Prat airport. Also across the street from a mall commercial district and an Lidl discount mart.* (did not use) Hotel-wide wireless internet access and cool infinity style pools.Negatives:* No customer-use business office or computer available though at time of purchase their website says there is.* False hardwood floors are incredibly noisy, you'll hear other travelers walking around two to three rooms over.* Maintenance was sub-par, my first room the shower was visibly broken, my second the air conditioning unit didn't work.* Rooms on the 5th floor facing towards the city center (or castle) smell horribly like sewer gas that emits from the restroom - you can even smell it in the hall.* Rooms on the 5th floor facing towards Barcelona (above the restaurant) have a low-frequency hum that shuts on and off all night. Everyone had to wear ear-plugs in order to sleep.* The staff was mostly uncooperative and inattentive, though there were a couple of exceptions.* The restaurant is fairly sub-par (stay away from the beef) and keeping with Spanish tradition does not open until 8:30pm for dinner - go elsewhere.* Non-smoking floors have ashbins near the elevators, and as with most hotels guests smoke in the rooms anyway - just be prepared.* In the shower, water pressure varies from minute to minute and occasionally will switch from warm to cold briefly - highly entertaining. It also has incredibly soft water so expect to spend a long time washing soap off. Oddly, one day the water was hard - I have to assume they have a water filtration device that is malfunctioning.* The king beds are actually two small twins pushed together. This is not uncommon, though this hotel does not use a joiner so enjoy sleeping on the joint between the two beds. The beds in both rooms were hard as rock.* No irons available (odd for a business hotel, even in Europe), and nearly four Euro per shirt to iron.
Reviews.Author: ha9jsu1s
